sentence.Network_cn: 从克拉斯特到牛顿有一条两英里的海滨小径。

sentence.Network_en: During the second world war he served with RAF Coastal Command.
sentence.Network_cn: 二战期间他在英国皇家空军海防总队服役。

entry.def: Coastal is used to refer to things that are in the sea or on the land near a coast.

example.ex: Local radio stations serving coastal areas often broadcast forecasts for yachtsmen...
example.tran: 服务沿海地区的地方广播电台经常为驾驶游艇出海的人播报天气预报。

example.ex: The fish are on sale from our own coastal waters.
example.tran: 出售的鱼来自我们自己的近海水域。

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to a coast;
2. located on or near or bordering on a coast;

Sentence.sentence: Many coastal cities will be covered with water.
How vulnerable the coastal cities are

Among global warming's most frightening threats is the prediction is that the polar ice-caps will melt, raising sea level so much that coastal cities from New York to Los Angles to Shanghai will be flooded.

means.word_mean: 在海岸上的;临海的,沿海的,靠近海岸的

sentences.en: Is the coastal plain good for growing crops?
sentences.cn: 沿海的平原适合种庄稼吗?

sentences.en: Ocean waves are gradually eating away the coastal rocks.
sentences.cn: 海浪正在慢慢地侵蚀着岸边的岩石。

sentences.en: Of course,no country has the privilege of fishing in our coastal water.
sentences.cn: 当然,在我国的领海内没有一个国家有捕鱼的特权。
